dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, big news coming out this week, uh, from Capitol Hill. It looks like Senator Kamala Harris and Representative Kevin McCarthy have teamed up on some new legislation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, big news coming out this week, uh, from Capitol Hill. It looks like Senator Kamala Harris and Representative Kevin McCarthy have teamed up on some new legislation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and Rep. Pramila Jayapal (D-Wash.) on Wednesday introduced legislation to make college tuition free for millions of Americans, paid for by a new tax on Wall Street trades.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? That's an interesting duo. What are they pushing for?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? That's an interesting duo. What are they pushing for?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they're introducing a bill that aims to make college tuition free for millions of Americans.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they're introducing a bill that aims to make college tuition free for millions of Americans.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and Rep. Pramila Jayapal (D-Wash.) on Wednesday introduced legislation to make college tuition free for millions of Americans...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, free college! That's, um, a pretty ambitious goal. How exactly would that work?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, free college! That's, um, a pretty ambitious goal. How exactly would that work?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so the "College for All Plan" would make community college and trade school free for everyone. And then, like, for public four-year universities, it would eliminate tuition for families earning under $150,000 a year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so the College for All Plan would make community college and trade school free for everyone. And then, like, for public four-year universities, it would eliminate tuition for families earning under one hundred fifty thousand dollars a year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The College for All Plan would make community college and trade school tuition free for everyone, and it would eliminate tuition at public four-year colleges and universities for students from families earning less than $125,000 per year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so not entirely free for everyone, but still a pretty wide net. Does it include, like, private schools at all?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so not entirely free for everyone, but still a pretty wide net. Does it include, like, private schools at all?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good question! It *would* make tuition free at private Historically Black Colleges and Universities, and other minority-serving institutions, but again, only for students from families in that same income bracket.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good question! It would make tuition free at private Historically Black Colleges and Universities, and other minority-serving institutions, but again, only for students from families in that same income bracket.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would also make tuition free at private Historically Black Colleges and Universities and other minority-serving institutions for students from families in that income bracket.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Interesting. And how are they planning to pay for all of this? Because that sounds like a colossal investment, um, to say the least.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Interesting. And how are they planning to pay for all of this? Because that sounds like a colossal investment, um, to say the least.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the big question, right? They're proposing a separate bill, the "Tax on Main Street Investment Act." It would levy new taxes on financial transactionsâ€”like a 0.6% tax on stock trades, for example.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the big question, right? They're proposing a separate bill, the Tax on Main Street Investment Act. It would levy new taxes on financial transactions-like a zero point six percent tax on stock trades, for example.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The federal investments in education and tuition would be paid for with a separate bill called the Tax on Wall Street Speculation Act, which would levy a new tax of 0.5% on stock trades...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, a financial transaction tax? I feel like I've heard Senator Harris float that idea before, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, a financial transaction tax? I feel like I've heard Senator Harris float that idea before, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This isnt the first time Sanders has pushed for a financial transaction taxhe floated the idea during his presidential campaign in 2016 and introduced legislation containing the tax in 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You're absolutely right! This isn't her first time. She actually brought it up during her vice presidential campaign and introduced similar legislation in 2020.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You're absolutely right! This isn't her first time. She actually brought it up during her vice presidential campaign and introduced similar legislation in twenty twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This isnt the first time Sanders has pushed for a financial transaction taxhe floated the idea during his presidential campaign in 2016 and introduced legislation containing the tax in 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So this is, uh, a consistent theme for her. What's the, like, the driving force behind it, beyond just making college cheaper?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this is, uh, a consistent theme for her. What's the, like, the driving force behind it, beyond just making college cheaper?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, McCarthy's quote really highlights it. He said Congress needs to ensure working families never have to take out "crushing loans" for higher education.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, McCarthy's quote really highlights it. He said Congress needs to ensure working families never have to take out crushing loans for higher education.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While President Biden can and should immediately cancel student debt for millions of borrowers, Congress must ensure that working families never have to take out these crushing loans to receive a higher education in the first place, Jayapal said in a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Makes sense. Now, you mentioned the tax to fund it. Do they have, like, an estimated revenue for that? How much money are we talking about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes sense. Now, you mentioned the tax to fund it. Do they have, like, an estimated revenue for that? How much money are we talking about?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They're projecting a *huge* number: $2.8 trillion over the next decade. That's what the proponents are saying it could raise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're projecting a huge number: two point eight trillion dollars over the next decade. That's what the proponents are saying it could raise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $2.4 trillion. Thats how much the new tax on Wall Street transactions could raise over the next decade, according to a summary of the legislation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Two point eight TRILLION? That's a massive amount. But, um, is that estimate holding up under scrutiny?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two point eight TRILLION? That's a massive amount. But, um, is that estimate holding up under scrutiny?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Not entirely, no. When the Tax Policy Center looked at a similar proposal from Harris's campaign, they estimated it would only generate about $500 billion. So, quite a big difference there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not entirely, no. When the Tax Policy Center looked at a similar proposal from Harris's campaign, they estimated it would only generate about five hundred billion dollars. So, quite a big difference there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the Tax Policy Center analyzed Sanders campaign proposal for a financial transaction tax (a plan he said would raise $3 trillion over a decade), it concluded that the proposal would only generate about $400 billion in revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, that's a significant gap. And I'm guessing not everyone is a fan of, like, these new taxes on financial transactions?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, that's a significant gap. And I'm guessing not everyone is a fan of, like, these new taxes on financial transactions?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely not. Tom Quaadman from the U.S. Chamber was a chief critic, saying it would decrease returns for people saving for big purchases and make it harder for businesses to raise capital.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely not. Tom Quaadman from the U S Chamber was a chief critic, saying it would decrease returns for people saving for big purchases and make it harder for businesses to raise capital.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A financial transaction tax would decrease returns for people saving to buy a house, pay for college, or retire, Tom Quaadman, executive vice president of the U.S. Chamber Center for Capital Markets Competitiveness, said in a statement reported by CNBC in 2019. It would also make it more expensive for businesses to raise the capital they need to start, expand, and create jobs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, a big, ambitious proposal with, uh, some pretty serious questions about its funding and economic impact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, a big, ambitious proposal with, uh, some pretty serious questions about its funding and economic impact.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. A lot to unpack if this moves forward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. A lot to unpack if this moves forward.
